messages.message: @Clemens Will do a brief brainstorm on it for effort estimation.

BTW, this was an explicit decision that we had made where we said we would only support pdfs and images from Google drive.  If we need to support the native Google types, we'll have to add support to export them out of Google Drive in some office friendly format.

Adding @Yash Botadra and @Heymian for the Google Drive Integration piece.
Part of the drive integration can we notify a user if the file has been modified especially if they will be conversing with it.
Yes, that was another explicit decision on the drive integration as well.  I'll work with Clemens / Varun to figure out the notification process.
Can I ask why this decision was made. Seems if we are going to integrate into a system that is highly used for google like documents we would have considered it.

We considered it, and decided that the first version would only include PDFs and Images because that is the initial signal we got.  Now that we are getting new signals for other document types, we will add those in as well.
Awesome thanks @shaunak. Once you have effort estimate and timelines please let us know. We owe CP leadership feedback to go-no/go a PoC
Thank you @shaunak! Appreciate the team is looking at the possibility to reconsider this.

Exporting Google workspace docs seems to be supported by the Google Drive API (docs (https://developers.google.com/drive/api/guides/manage-downloads#export_document_content)). There is also a list of supported mime types that each doc can be exported to: https://developers.google.com/drive/api/guides/ref-export-formats

Weâ€™ll need to do a POC to confirm the feasibility of doing this. Tracking updates to these files and providing notifications or auto-syncing are different, more complicated items though.
cc @hannah @Heymian we might have to add this to our OKRs for Q3.
